`No interest` is from tech perspective, deleting a row in some storage, such as ElasticSearch will be a performance impact, which could cause issues, in some cases.
I am confused, during the discussion, I said https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/5997#issuecomment-743729015. I can't see the question had been answered and provided reasonable explanation.

For example, imagine in a scenario where there is an operation's QPS changes during the day, say 10000 in the evening and 100 in the morning. If I want a portion of all the samples to be sampled, a fixed `sample_n_per_3_secs` would not work very well because it's kind of hard to determine what value should be used for it. If I set it relative to QPS = 100, too less samples would be sampled when QPS = 10000. If I set it relative to QPS = 10000, all the traces in other time might be sampled. Besides I need know the current QPS in order to set it right. In this case if one can just specify a number indicating the percentage rate, it would be way easier to achieve this.

Also we do understand that the sample rate would not be accurate, that's expected. This plugin doesn't intend to be accurate either.
In summary this plugin just provides another way to specify how often one would like traces to be sampled, please consider its use cases. Not all users need this of course, but maybe some users would consider this useful.
